posts.post_content: Pj34: Yes, if I'm not mistaken, if a permanent "enters the battlefield with x counters" that still counts as an effect that places counters on that permanent (just like planeswalkers entering with double counters if you have doubling season).

posts.post_content:
Step 1: Flash in [The Mimeoplasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=The Mimeoplasm) just before your turn and exile this.  
Step 2: Have The 'plasm exile [Lord of Extinction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of Extinction), or the new [Consuming Aberration](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Consuming Aberration).  
Step 3: Have a giant Ooze Mutant Wizard that can cast, assuming an 18/18 Lord or Aberration-  
A 21/21 [Llanowar Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elf), a 21/21 [Fathom Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fathom Mage) (drawing 20), a 21/22 [Gyre Sage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gyre Sage) capable of tapping for 20 Green Mana, or a 41/41 [Prime Speaker Zegana](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prime Speaker Zegana) (drawing 41) O\_o  
  
Yeah, I like this card.

Posted By: Cyber_Squirrel (5/12/2013 6:30:06 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ Secksee  
Actually, 'as' is grammatically correct in this case. If you remove the part about the +1/+1 counters, the text reads as "Each other creature you control enters the battlefield as a Mutant in addition to its other types". Note that this has an additional effect - it means that creatures you control that are already on the battlefield when Master Biomancer enters the battlefield do not spontaneously become Mutants. The additional type only applies to new creatures.  
  
I've decided that I want this guy for my Bookkeeping deck. [Misthollow Griffin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Misthollow Griffin), [Havengul Runebinder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Havengul Runebinder), Master Biomancer, and a sacrifice outlet. Tokens! Counters! Tokens with counters! How big is that zombie? I don't know anymore!
posts.html:
@ Secksee
Actually, 'as' is grammatically correct in this case. If you remove the part about the +1/+1 counters, the text reads as "Each other creature you control enters the battlefield as a Mutant in addition to its other types". Note that this has an additional effect - it means that creatures you control that are already on the battlefield when Master Biomancer enters the battlefield do not spontaneously become Mutants. The additional type only applies to new creatures.

I've decided that I want this guy for my Bookkeeping deck. Misthollow Griffin, Havengul Runebinder, Master Biomancer, and a sacrifice outlet. Tokens! Counters! Tokens with counters! How big is that zombie? I don't know anymore!

posts.post_content: This is one of my favourite cards ever. Ridiculously silly. Ridiculously fun to play. Makes just about any creature playable. Stacks with itself. Stacks even better with clones. Has a whole host of Simic cards printed in this set that interact with him in interesting and powerful ways. He brings awesome mathematical complexity to the table. I can't gush enough, this card rules.
